lines.text: Charlie, will I ever see you again?
Sure you will, kid. You know goodbyes aren't forever.
Then goodbye, Charlie. I love you.
Yep... I love you too.
Charlie, will you help me find a mom and dad?
Kid, I'll help you find the lost city of Atlantis! Just please, please go to sleep!
All dogs go to heaven because, unlike people, dogs are naturally good and loyal and kind.
MORONS! I'm surrounded by MORONS!
Hey guys, waddua ya know, waddua ya say?
Yeah, waddua ya say, waddua ya know?
What are the odds on Terrible Tom?
Terrible.
Hey! I know we're all dead up here, but so's the music. How about heating it up?
Honey, you know it!
[Upbeat gospel music plays]
That's nice. That's nice.
Killer, take Charlie out back for the big surprise.
Surprise? What surprise, boss?
The big...
[Does throat-slashing gesture]
...surprise.

[pours a mess of ketchup on his sandwich like blood on his hand]
Oh, you mean that surprise?
[Killer faints with his hand still up]

[taps ashes out of his cigar onto the sandwich]
You moron.
These are some of the poorest people I know. They're more broke than the Ten Commandments.
[laughs]
That was a little joke. Very little.
What a selfish, hopeless, callous heel of a cad I've been. Blind to the needs of society's lowly unloved.
Gamblers are never happy, Charlie.
Hey, wait. That looks like a water main.
Naw, water mains are green. This is red!
Itchy, you're color blind. You've always been color blind.
That's true, but this is green.
Its red.
Red?
[drills into pipe; outside, water bursts out of the ground, and the tunnel floods]

[singing]
Welcome to being dead.

[horrified]
What? You mean I'm... I'm...

[flipping through a record book of Charlie's life]
Stone cold I'm afraid.
I can't believe it, I've been murdered!
I'm having trouble finding any goodness or loyalty here, but let me see.
He killed me!
I beg your pardon?
There's a mistake been made here!
[singing]

I don't wanna die/You got the wrong guy/I was double crossed by a dirty rat, actually this rat was a dog but his car ran me down/I just blew out of jail, I just got back to town/Hey! This is hard to explain/May I speak to your Superior because I don't wanna die!

[singing]
Welcome to doing whatever you wish...

[interrupting]
You got the wrong guy.

[singing]
Laughing and singing all day.
Hey! Listen! My time's not up yet!
Oh but it is, there's no mistake about that, we know everything.
Murdered in the prime of my life! That Carface, I'll kill him!
In him there's the luck of the Irish.
The pride of the German.
Even, he-he, a bit of Siam.
Siam? There's the calm of the English.
The charm of the Spanish.
A pedigree certainly ain't what I am. So call me a mixed-up pup.
You're a mixed-up pup.
But the only way this pup knows is up!

[singing]
I love Brazil / The throb, the thrill / I've never been there / But someday I will / Adventure and danger / Love from a stranger / Let me be surprised.
She's burning up a fever, Charlie. She could have pneumonia!
Think she needs a vet?
Charlie, she's a little girl. She needs a doctor.
Doctor? I don't know any doctors... I'll find one!
Anne-Marie do you like your waffles?
Oh, yes! Very much, thank you.
No, thank you!
Anne-Marie where do you live?
I live with Charlie! He's my dog.
But where do you stay?
With Charlie in the junk yard.

[singing]
All I have is a picture in my mind of how it would be, if we were together... Let's pretend that you're far away, let's say you write to me. And you promise in your letter, that you'll come home! Come home, to my heart. And when we're together, we can never be apart. If I keep dreaming of you, make believe that it's true; then soon you'll come home. Home to my heart! Soon you'll come home, home to my heart! If I believe!

[Anne Marie tells them the horse Chawhee is going to win, but it's a surprise]
Can we trust this horse?
[horse brays at him violently]
Alright! The Grand Cha-hee, Che-haw, Chaw-hee-hee-hoo-ha, by surprise!
[Charlie has escaped the pound]
Charlie? Ain't you supposed to be on death row?

[angrily]
No. I AIN'T supposed to be on death row.
Things have changed, Charlie, since you've been gone... Life hasn't been no piece of cake.
Carface ain't been treating us too good.
Things are tough, but we carry on...

[Charlie wins a game of craps]
Could you spare a couple of bones, for old time's sake?
Why settle for a couple of bones when you could have the whole bank?
[puts the craps bones in a slot machine and breaks the bank]
Ya won the jackpot! Charlie, I'm proud of ya.
Charlie's alive, and I know he's got the girl. Killer, this is strike two. You're out.
No, boss! I have one more strike, boss! Honest!
Come on, Chawhee! You can do it, it's your birthday!
I don't care if it's his... his bar mitzvah. That horse is a gluepot.
You must have taken dance lessons. You have natural rhythm, unusual in a whippet.
[last lines]
Argh! I'll get that gator, if it's the last thing I do!
Touch that clock, and you can never come back.
Shut up.

[shouts and chases him]
I said, touch that clock, and you can never come back!
He'll be back.
Yah! Someone's got me by the tail!
I got you by the tail!
Why don't you tell somebody you're gonna do that?
You know, it's not worth it being with you. It's not.
Your hands are cold, too.
All we need now is a couple of bucks.
A couple of bucks, a couple of bucks!
A couple, a couple. Mmm, yeah! A mom and dad.
Yeah, sure.

[to Charlie]
Ah, you look like a tasty New Orleans canine gumbo!
No! Don't eat him, please!
[King Gator puts Charlie in his mouth and prepares to eat him, but Charlie howls really loudly]
Ah.
[removes Charlie from his mouth]
How can you expect me to eat a voice as sumptuous as this?
What do you call that voice, little fella? Is that a baritone or a tenor?
It's a...
Oh, I don't care. It's just you and me.
[singing]
Let's make music together / Let's make sweet harmony...

[after Itchy tells him to get ride of Anne-Marie]
Aw, Itch, now the casino's gone. We've got to start all over; we need the girl more than ever.
No, boss, you're crazy! It's not business anymore, it's personal!
Aw, come on, Itchy. Surely it's just business, I mean...
You're in love with the girl! You've got soft, you care about her!

[furiously annoyed]
Look, I don't care about the girl! I tell her things now and then! I pretend to be her best friend, but it's baloney!
I thought I was your best friend...

[yells]
YOU ARE MY BEST FRIEND! With her, it's just business - it's always been business! I'm USING the girl! And when we're done with her, we'll dump her in an orphanage! Is that okay with you!

[chastened]
Sure, boss, anything you say.
[sees Anne-Marie, who overheard everything]
Uh-oh...

[crying, goes hurt]
You're not my friend... You're a bad dog!
Charlie, let me think about this...
No! Don't think! From now on, I'll do the thinking!

[Itchy's dropping ice cream on him]
Hey cut it out, would you? What do you see up there?
Mostly the backs of the buttons, but other than that...

[to a horse after it scares him]
If you do that to me one more time, you are glue!

[thinking Charlie's a ghost]
Take my 9 piece ratchet set, my oil tin! Don't go away without my Rolls Royce hood ornament!
[hits Charlie on the head with it]
Please, I've got a bad back! Ah, don't touch!
I can't help it, Charlie, I always itch when I'm nervous.
Well don't be nervous!
Just scratch this!
That Carface has something up his sleeve.
Yeah, a gun!
And when I find out what it is, I'm going to ruin him.
Boss, Carface has got thugs, and they've got muscles, and knives, and he's got a monster.
Monster?
Boss, they feed it!
Monster?
Yes that's what I said, monster!
Itchy, what happened to you?
You want to know what happened to me? I'll tell you what happened to me. Carface happened to me, with about 50 of his thugs. Oh!
Itch, I'm sorry.
Well, look what else happened while you were sidetracked. See that?
[see a building on fire]
That's *our* place! You were going to fix Carface well, well he fixed us! You see boss, this whole thing's gone too far.

[horse race, runs to Sir Reginald]
Yoo-hoo! Reginald! Excuse me!

[chuckles]
Oh! Splendid! Hello, Stella. Jolly good day for a race, of course.

[sweetly]
Oh, yes. But Reginald, honey - and I do have to hate to rain on your parade - but did you know...
[different, angry, stern tone]
...it's the Grand Chawhee's birthday?

[chuckles]
Oh, really? You don't...
[loses his monocle and goes awestruck]
Oh! I'm terribly sorry.

[about the group of mouse-like natives]
What they saying? Tell 'em to gimme back my watch!
I can't, Charlie. They talk funny.
I don't care!

[When Carface falls into the water]
Mmm! Delicious!
[laughs and chases the screaming Carface]
